# üîê User Login API Documentation

## Endpoint

```
POST /api/user/login

 ```

## Base URL

```
http://localhost:8000/api/user/login

 ```

---

## Description

Authenticates a user using email and password, and returns:

- Access Token (in Authorization header)
    
- Refresh Token (in HTTP-only cookie)
    
- User role
    
- First time login status
    

---

## Authentication

Required: ‚ùå No

(This is the login endpoint)

---

## Headers

```
Content-Type: application/json

 ```

---

## Request Body (JSON)

```
{
  "email": "john@gmail.com",
  "password": "12345678"
}

 ```

---

## Field Explanation

| Field | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| email | String | ‚úÖ | Registered email |
| password | String | ‚úÖ | User password |

---

## Success Response

Status: **200 OK**

Headers:

```
Authorization: Bearer <accessToken>
Set-Cookie: refreshToken=<refreshToken>; HttpOnly

 ```

Body:

```
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Login successful",
  "data": {
    "role": "user",
    "firstTimeLogin": true
  }
}

 ```

---

## Important: Tokens Location

### Access Token

Returned in response header:

```
Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...

 ```

Use this token for protected routes.

---

### Refresh Token

Stored in cookie:

```
refreshToken=eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...

 ```

Used to generate new access token.

---

# Error Responses

---

## Missing email or password

Status: **400 Bad Request**

```
{
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "Email and password are required"
}

 ```

---

## Invalid email

Status: **401 Unauthorized**

```
{
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "Email or password incorrect"
}

 ```

---

## Invalid password

Status: **401 Unauthorized**

```
{
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "Email or password incorrect"
}

 ```

---

# Postman Setup Instructions

---

## Step 1: Create request

Method:

```
POST

 ```

URL:

```
http://localhost:3000/api/user/login

 ```

---

## Step 2: Headers

```
Content-Type: application/json

 ```

---

## Step 3: Body ‚Üí raw ‚Üí JSON

```
{
  "email": "john@gmail.com",
  "password": "12345678"
}

 ```

---

## Step 4: Click Send

---

## Step 5: Copy Access Token

From response Headers:

```
Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9...

 ```

Use in other APIs:

```
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN

 ```

---

# What happens internally

When login succeeds:

‚úî Password compared using bcrypt

‚úî Access token generated

‚úî Refresh token generated

‚úî Refresh token saved in database

‚úî Refresh token stored in HTTP-only cookie

‚úî Access token returned in Authorization header

---

```
  "email": "john@gmail.com",
  "refreshToken": "eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9..."
}

 ```

# Important Bug Fix (You must fix)

Your code uses:

```
case 'name-asc': sortOption = { fullName: 1 };
case 'name-desc': sortOption = { fullName: -1 };

 ```

But your schema uses:

```
name: { type: String }

 ```

Fix it to:

```
case 'name-asc': sortOption = { name: 1 }; break;
case 'name-desc': sortOption = { name: -1 }; break;

 ```

---

# Correct Version

```
switch (req.query.sort) {
  case 'name-asc': sortOption = { name: 1 }; break;
  case 'name-desc': sortOption = { name: -1 }; break;
  case 'oldest': sortOption = { createdDate: 1 }; break;
  case 'recent': sortOption = { createdDate: -1 }; break;
  default: sortOption = { createdDate: -1 };
}

 ```

# ‚úèÔ∏è Update User API Documentation

## Endpoint

```
PUT /api/updateUser/:id

 ```

## Base URL

```
http://localhost:8000/api/updateUser/:id

 ```

Example:

```
http://localhost:8000/api/updateUser/65d3f8a2c123456789abcd12

 ```

---

## Description

Update a user‚Äôs information by ID.

- Admin only
    
- Password will be hashed automatically if updated
    
- Photo cannot be updated via this route (use upload-photo endpoint)
    

---

## Authorization

Required: ‚úÖ Yes

Role Required: ‚úÖ Admin

Header:

```
Authorization: Bearer <accessToken>

 ```

---

## Headers

```
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN

 ```

---

## URL Parameters

| Parameter | Type | Required | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| id | String | ‚úÖ | MongoDB User ID to update |

---

## Request Body (JSON)

Include only the fields you want to update:

```
{
  "name": "john_doe_updated",
  "email": "john_new@gmail.com",
  "password": "newpassword123",
  "phoneNumber": "0912345678",
  "location": "Addis Ababa",
  "bio": "Updated bio",
  "employeId": "EMP001",
  "department": "IT",
  "role": "user"
}

 ```

‚ö†Ô∏è Do **not** include `photo` in body ‚Äî it is ignored. Use the `/upload-photo` endpoint to update photos.

---

## Field Explanation

| Field | Type | Required | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| name | String | ‚ùå | User full name |
| email | String | ‚ùå | Must be unique |
| password | String | ‚ùå | Will be hashed automatically |
| phoneNumber | String | ‚ùå | Must be unique, 10 digits |
| location | String | ‚ùå | User location |
| bio | String | ‚ùå | User description |
| employeId | String | ‚ùå | Must be unique |
| department | String | ‚ùå | Department |
| role | String | ‚ùå | Values: `admin`, `user` |

---

## Success Response

Status: **200 OK**

```
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "User updated successfully.",
  "user": {
    "id": "65d3f8a2c123456789abcd12",
    "fullName": "john_doe_updated",
    "email": "john_new@gmail.com",
    "role": "user",
    "photo": "/images/UserPhotos/1708343434343-UserAvatar.png"
  }
}

 ```

‚ö†Ô∏è Note: Your controller returns `fullName`, but your schema uses `name`. You should update the controller to `updatedUser.name` to match the schema:

```
user: {
  id: updatedUser._id,
  name: updatedUser.name,
  email: updatedUser.email,
  role: updatedUser.role,
  photo: updatedUser.photo,
}

 ```

---

## Error Responses

---

### Unauthorized (No Token)

Status: **401 Unauthorized**

```
{
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "Unauthorized"
}

 ```

---

### Forbidden (Not Admin)

Status: **403 Forbidden**

```
{
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "Access denied"
}

 ```

---

### User Not Found

Status: **404 Not Found**

```
{
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "No user found with ID 65d3f8a2c123456789abcd12"
}

 ```

---

### Validation Error

Status: **400 Bad Request**

```
{
  "status": "fail",
  "message": "User validation failed",
  "errors": {
    "email": "Email already exists"
  }
}

 ```

---

3. Content-Type: application/jsonAuthorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN

## Endpoint

```
GET /api/getme

 ```

## Base URL

```
http://localhost:3000/api/getme

 ```

---

## Description

Fetches the currently authenticated user‚Äôs information.

- Requires a valid access token
    
- Returns limited user info (excluding password, refreshToken, etc.)
    

---

## Authorization

Required: ‚úÖ Yes  
  
Role Required: ‚ùå (any logged-in user)

Header:

```
Authorization: Bearer <accessToken>

 ```

---

## Headers

```
Content-Type: application/json
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN

 ```

---

---

## Success Response

Status: **200 OK**

```
{
  "status": "success",
 ```

### Add Gallery Entry (POST)

This endpoint handles the mixed upload of a **cover image** and an **array of gallery images**, creating a structured record in the database.

- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/api/addGallery`
    
- **Method:** `POST`
    
- **Auth:** `Bearer Token` (Required)
    
- **Body Type:** `form-data`
    

---

### üì• Request Body (form-data)

In Postman, go to the **Body** tab, select **form-data**, and enter these keys. **Note:** For file fields, hover over the Key cell and change the type from "Text" to "File".

| **Key** | **Type** | **Value (Example)** | **Description** |
| **coverImage** | **File** | `main_front.jpg` | **Required.** The primary display image (Max 2MB). |
| **images** | **File** | `[Multiple Files]` | **Optional.** Select multiple files to populate the gallery array. |
| **catagory** | Text | `Engineering` | **Required.** The group/category for the entry. |
| **fileType** | Text | `image` | **Required.** Specify the type (e.g., image, video). |
| **status** | Text | `Active` | Options: `Active` or `Inactive` (Defaults to Inactive). |

---

### ‚úÖ Success Response (201 Created)

```

  }
}

 ```

---

### ‚ùå Possible Errors

Managed by your `globalErrorHandler` and Multer limits:

| **Status Code** | **Message** | **Scenario** |
| **400** | `Please upload a cover image.` | The `coverImage` field was empty or missing. |
| **400** | `coverImage size exceeds 2MB limit.` | One of your files is larger than the 2MB limit set in `fileUpload.js`. |
| **400** | `Too many files uploaded for field "images".` | You attempted to upload more than 10 images at once. |
| **401** | `Unauthorized` | Missing or expired JWT token in the Authorization header. |
| **400** | `Invalid input data: ...` | Mongoose validation failed (e.g., missing `catagory` or `fileType`). |

---

1. Set method to **POST**.

### Get All Gallery Entries (GET)

This endpoint fetches a list of gallery entries with built-in pagination. It returns the total number of records available in the database to help the frontend calculate how many pages to display.

- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/api/getAllgallery`
    
- **Method:** `GET`
    
- **Auth:** None (Public)
    

---

### üîç Query Parameters

Add these to the **Params** tab in Postman to control which results you see:

| **Parameter** | **Type** | **Default** | **Description** |
| **`page`** | Number | `1` | The specific page of results you want to view. |

The response is structured to provide both the metadata (`total`) and the actual gallery items (`data`).

JSON

```

  "total": 45,
  "data": [

      "_id": "65d8f2a1b3c4d5e6f7g8h9i0",
      "coverImage": "/GaImageGallery/bridge_design-1715832000.jpg",

      "status": "Active",
      "Date": "2026-02-26T10:00:00.000Z"
    }
  ]
}

 ```

---

### üõ† Technical Logic

The controller uses an offset-based pagination strategy. Items are sorted by the `Date` field in descending order (`-Date`) so the newest uploads always appear first.

- **Total:** Represents every document matching the criteria in your collection.
    
- **Skip:** Calculated as $(page - 1) \\times 12$. If you are on page 2, the API skips the first 12 items.
    
- **Limit:** Hardcoded to `12` to ensure consistent grid layouts on the frontend.
    

---

### üß™ Sample Testing in Postman

1. Set method to **GET**.
    
2. Enter the URL: `{{base_url}}/api/getAllgallery?page=1`.
    
3. **Check the** **`total`** **field:** This tells you how many total items exist across all pages.
    
4. **Check the** **`data`** **array:** This contains the 12 most recent gallery entries.

### Get Single Gallery Entry (GET)

This endpoint retrieves the full details of a specific gallery item using its unique database ID. It is useful for displaying a dedicated detail page or a full-screen gallery view.

- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/api/getGallery/:id`
    
- **Method:** `GET`
    
- **Auth:** None (Public)
    

---

### üîç Path Parameters

To use this in Postman, replace `:id` in the URL with the actual `_id` string from a previous "Get All" request.

| **`id`** | String | `65d8f2a1b3c4d5e6f7g8h9i0` | The MongoDB ObjectID of the gallery entry. |

The response returns a single object containing all fields, including the full array of gallery images.

JSON

```

  "status": "success",
  "data": {
    "_id": "65d8f2a1b3c4d5e6f7g8h9i0",
    "coverImage": "/GaImageGallery/main_design-1715832000.jpg",
    "images": [
      "/GaImageGallery/extra1-1715832001.jpg",
      "/GaImageGallery/extra2-1715832002.jpg",
      "/GaImageGallery/extra3-1715832003.jpg"
    ],
    "fileType": "image",
    "catagory": "Architecture",
    "status": "Active",
    "Date": "2026-02-26T14:30:00.000Z"
  }
}

 ```

---

### ‚ùå Possible Errors

| **Status Code** | **Message** | **Scenario** |
| **404** | `No gallery found with ID ...` | The ID is formatted correctly, but no document exists with that ID. |
| **400** | `Invalid ID: ...` | The ID provided is not a valid MongoDB ObjectID (handled by `handleCastErrorDB`). |

---

### üß™ Sample Testing in Postman

1. Set the method to **GET**.
    
2. Copy an `_id` from your `getAllgallery` response.
    
3. Paste it into the URL: `{{base_url}}/api/getGallery/65d8f2a1b3c4d5e6f7g8h9i0`.
    
4. **Hit Send.**

### Delete Gallery Entry (DELETE)

This endpoint permanently removes a gallery record from the database and **automatically deletes** all associated image files (the `coverImage` and the `images` array) from the server's disk to save storage space.

- **URL:** `{{base_url}}/api/deleteGallery/:id`
    
- **Method:** `DELETE`
    
- **Auth:** `Bearer Token` (Required)
    
- **Permissions:** `admin`, `user`
    

---

### üîç Path Parameters

Replace `:id` in the URL with the unique `_id` of the gallery entry you wish to remove.

| **Parameter** | **Type** | **Example Value** | **Description** |
| **`id`** | String | `65d8f2a1b3c4d5e6f7g8h9i0` | The MongoDB ObjectID of the entry. |

---

### üõ† Behind the Scenes: Cleanup Logic

Unlike a standard delete, your controller performs a "Deep Delete":

1. **Find:** Locates the document to get the file paths.
    
2. **Unlink:** Loops through the `coverImage` string and the `images` array to delete the actual `.jpg` or `.png` files from the `/public/images/GaImageGallery` folder.
    
3. **Remove:** Deletes the document from MongoDB.
    

---

### ‚úÖ Success Response (200 OK)

JSON

```
{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Gallery entry and associated files deleted successfully."
}

 ```

---

### ‚ùå Possible Errors

| **Status Code** | **Message** | **Scenario** |
| **404** | `No Document found with ID ...` | The ID is valid but does not exist in the database. |
| **401** | `Unauthorized` | No token provided or token has expired. |
| **403** | `Forbidden` | You are logged in, but your role is not "admin" or "user". |
| **400** | `Invalid ID: ...` | The ID string is malformed (e.g., `123-abc`). |

---

### üß™ Sample Testing in Postman

1. Set the method to **DELETE**.
    
2. In **Headers**, ensure `Authorization` is set to `Bearer` .
    
3. Enter the URL: `{{base_url}}/api/deleteGallery/65d8f2a1b3c4d5e6f7g8h9i0`.
    
4. **Hit Send.**
    
5. _Verification:_ Try to "GET" the same ID; it should now return a **404**.
